16. **SNAPPING CAN ENDANGER**

   Mention any animals which you recall in the neighborhood and on the property.

   In the early days, there was a war in the area. The enemy was very close to our home.

   Our family was very much involved in the war effort.

17. Give a typical day's menu (breakfast, dinner & supper) for the earliest year you can remember. Give the year and list the members of the family or group.

   Breakfast favorite: scrambled eggs, toast, coffee

   Dinner: homemade fried chicken, mashed potatoes, green beans

   Supper: homemade pasta, salad, dessert

18. What year did you serve your first Christmas dinner in the eastern Kansas?

   *Give the date.*

   It was the year 1900 when we served our first Christmas dinner.

   We had turkey, potatoes, gravy, plum pudding, home-made pie.

   Butter, sugar, and milk were my two favorites.

   Garden and hay bunnings were around 26-33 years old.

19. Have you ever resorted to almost starvation level living on any of your locally produced foods? Give details.

   The only times we found our diet met a special need were during the Great Depression. We had no choice but to rely on our own resources.

   We grew our own vegetables and raised our own chickens.

   No food came from the store; everything was grown on our own land.

   We lived in our home for nine months without electricity.

   The family was hard hit by the Great Depression.

   We moved to the city to find work.

   The family was forced to move to the city due to the economic downturn.

   We moved to the city to find work.

   The family was forced to move to the city due to the economic downturn.
15. **SNAPPELS AV GIVETTE**

   Mention any changes which you recall in the instructions and explanations received at the time you purchased (give them here precisely).

   In the early days, I often used sugar packs for the flavoring. I now rarely use anything except the flavoring in my recipes.

16. **BREAKFAST FAVORITE**

   Breakfast favorite was oatmeal, fruit, eggs, toast, or muffins. We always had a fried egg on top.

17. **What year did you serve your first Christmas dinner in Montana?**

   It was the year 1908 when we moved our first Christmas dinner in all our years. We had turkey, potatoes, gravy, plum pudding, home-made pie, and butter. Our dad said it was my first dinner.

   Garden + May running home, around 26 + 23 year old

   The only family we knew was the Smith family. They were very kind to us.

Each year it was made more convenient to get prepared foods after the railroad came through. We had a baker & could get cakes as well as bakers bread if so desired.
